metadata.description:
This data set contains meteorological observation data of meteorological elements from January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2016 on the haihewen meteorological observation network in yaokou station.The station is located in da dong shu pass, qilian county, qinghai province.The latitude and longitude of the observation point are 100.2421E, 38.0142N, and 4148m above sea level.The published data included two observation points, both of which were in the observation station of mountain pass, about 10m apart. Specifically, the air temperature and relative humidity sensors were set up at 5m, facing due north (the two observation groups output 10min and 30min respectively).The barometer is installed in an anti-skid box on the ground (two groups of observation, 10min and 30min output respectively);The inverted bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed and direction sensor is set at 10m, facing due north (two groups, respectively 10min and 30min output);The four-component radiometer consists of two observation points, one of which is installed at the 6m position of the weather tower, facing due south (10min output), and the other is installed on a support 1.5m above the ground (30min output).The two infrared thermometers are installed at the position of 6m, facing south, and the probe is facing vertically downward.The soil temperature probe was buried at 0cm on the surface and 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground (the two groups were observed and output for 10min and 30min respectively).The soil moisture probes were buried in the ground at 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm (the two groups were observed and output for 10min and 30min respectively).The soil heat flux plates were buried 6cm underground (observed in two groups for 10min (3 heat flux plates) and 30min (2 heat flux plates) respectively).
Observation items are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m, RH_5m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:C), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts/m2), soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm) (unit: Celsius), soil moisture (Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm, Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit: volume water content, percentage).
Processing and quality control of observation data :(1) ensure 144 or 48 data per day (every 10min or 30min). If data is missing, it will be marked by -6999;(2) eliminate the moments with duplicate records;(3) data that is obviously beyond the physical meaning or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked by red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) the format of date and time is uniform, and the date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 10:30 on 10th September 2016;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
Please refer to Liu et al. (2018) for hydrometeorological network or site information, and Liu et al. (2011) for observation data processing.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2016年1月1日至2016年12月31日黑河文气象观测网上游垭口站气象要素观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县大冬树垭口，下垫面是高寒草甸。观测点的经纬度是100.2421E, 38.0142N，海拔4148m。发布的数据包括两个观测点，均在垭口观测站，相距10m左右，具体包括：空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m处，朝向正北（两组观测，分别10min和30min输出）；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内（两组观测，分别10min和30min输出）；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速与风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北（两组，分别10min和30min输出）；四分量辐射仪包含两个观测点，其中一个安装在气象塔6m处，朝向正南（10min输出），另一个安装在离地1.5m高的支架上（30min输出）；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处（两组观测，分别10min和30min输出）；土壤水分探头埋设在地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处（两组观测，分别10min和30min输出）；土壤热流板埋设在地下6cm处（两组观测，分别10min（3块热流板）和30min（2块热流板）输出）。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144或48个数据（每10min或30min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2016-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型包含的所需参数和观测数据无法从操作卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）通量测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。在这封信中，显示出与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强平流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散发（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估计蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的EC系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率。这是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的放大是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而解决这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years.

The associated open-access datasets include high-quality hydrometeorological data with specific respect to snow and frozen ground observations at the sub-basin and basin scales, which aims to address a variety of scientific questions including but not limited to: (1) how to provide accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, (2) how to integrate observation, simulation and the acquired datasets for informative understanding, and (3) how perturbations (climate change and human activities) alter fundamental processes.
challenges: However, several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. However, the above modeling efforts suffered from 1) the availability of the forcing data (only two weather stations operated by the Chinese Meteorological Administration functioned in the upper reaches of the HRB) and 2) a lack of high-quality snow and frozen ground data for parameterization.
Unfortunately, this did not work well due to the influence of strong wind. Therefore, snow density data, which can be calculated using snow depth and SWE data, are not available at present.
methods: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets were also obtained to capture the freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.

Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets were also obtained to capture the freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation. The updated datasets were released to scientists with multidisciplinary backgrounds (i.e., cryosphere science, hydrology, and meteorology), and they are expected to serve as a testing platform to provide accurate forcing data and validate and evaluate remote sensing products and hydrological models for a broader community.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years. Composed of seven standard hydrometeorological stations, one snow superstation and one frozen ground superstation, the observation network serves as an integrated research platform aiming to provide prominent datasets (e.g., hydrometeorology, snow, and frozen ground) of the hydrometeorological processes in the upper reaches of the HRB, which is expected to support alpine region hydrological model development and simulations along with remote sensing observation.

A comprehensive snow dataset from the Yakou snow superstation has been updated since the summer of 2013. The observed snow variables included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE) and blowing (drifting) snow. Data obtained from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 are summarized in Figure 4, with additional plots for precipitation, ET, soil temperature and moisture. The datasets are available from 2012/12/05 to 2017/12/31, with intermittent loss mostly due to power loss and sensor malfunctions at high altitudes.

In this paper, a suite of alpine hydrology datasets observed from an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) is presented.
backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的贡献者，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近期气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，这就需要下一代观测和建模方法来推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文建模和相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在阿尔卑斯地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进阿尔卑斯地区水文研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对阿尔卑斯水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在阿尔卑斯水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要的指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是阿尔卑斯地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，进而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进阿尔卑斯水文研究，国际阿尔卑斯研究流域水文网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领阿尔卑斯地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱HRB生态水文过程的主要组成部分，阿尔卑斯水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，从而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖广泛分布，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也很常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪层的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂移雪）。估计吹雪的发生是重要的，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，而这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。

本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是关于雪和冻土观测的数据，涵盖子流域和流域尺度，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：（1）如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，（2）如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有意义的理解，以及（3）扰动（气候变化和人类活动）如何改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，严酷的寒冷气候、高海拔和复杂的地形等多重严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游运营的两个气象站正常工作）；2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并不顺利。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无缝的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMSs）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，配备了七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。IOP结束后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。积雪和融雪过程在雅口雪超级站自动测量，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和吹雪（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次上进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区的三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在阿柔冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在十八个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深是通过SR50A（美国Campbell公司）测量的，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）是通过GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，Campbell，USA）从2014年1月1日到2017年12月31日以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量的。FlowCapt（IAV，瑞士）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。

本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟以及遥感观测。
来自Yakou雪超级站的综合雪数据集自2013年夏季以来已更新。观察到的雪变量包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（漂雪）。2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日的数据在图4中进行了总结，并附有降水、蒸散发、土壤温度和湿度的额外图表。数据集的可用时间为2012年12月5日至2017年12月31日，间歇性丢失主要是由于高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'integrated observation network' in hydrological research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在水文研究中，“综合观测网络”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: An 'integrated observation network' in hydrological research is a comprehensive system that combines various types of observational data and instruments to monitor and analyze hydrometeorological processes. This network typically includes automatic meteorological stations, superstations for snow and frozen ground observations, and other technologies like remote sensing. It aims to provide a cohesive framework for collecting detailed data on meteorological, hydrological, and related environmental variables to support research and modeling efforts.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在水文研究中，“综合观测网络”是一个综合系统，结合了各种类型的观测数据和仪器，以监测和分析水文气象过程。该网络通常包括自动气象站、用于雪和冻土观测的超级站，以及遥感等其他技术。其目的是提供一个统一的框架，以收集有关气象、水文和相关环境变量的详细数据，以支持研究和建模工作。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced when collecting data in the alpine region of the Heihe River Basin compared to the oasis-desert region during HiWATER?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在HiWATER期间，收集黑河流域高山地区与绿洲-沙漠地区的数据时面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Data collection in the alpine region of the Heihe River Basin is challenged by harsh climates, high altitudes, and complex topography, which affect the consistency and availability of data. In contrast, data collection in the oasis-desert region during HiWATER is complicated by the need to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, requiring a hierarchically nested instrumentation network to address the heterogeneous landscape. The alpine region's challenges are more related to environmental conditions, whereas the oasis-desert challenges arise from the need for comprehensive multi-scale data integration.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在黑河流域的高山地区，数据收集受到恶劣气候、高海拔和复杂地形的挑战，这些因素影响了数据的一致性和可用性。相比之下，在绿洲-沙漠地区进行HiWATER的数据收集则因需要捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程而变得复杂，这要求建立一个分层嵌套的仪器网络，以应对异质的景观。高山地区的挑战更多与环境条件有关，而绿洲-沙漠地区的挑战则源于对全面多尺度数据整合的需求。

Such data capture the dynamics within oasis-desert systems, including water vapor fluxes, energy exchanges, and vegetation responses. This understanding is facilitated by a network of hierarchical instrumentation capturing data from multiple scales, which helps identify patterns and processes that influence water resource management and ecosystem services in these regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测数据为绿洲与沙漠生态系统之间的相互作用提供了重要的见解，揭示了生态水文过程在不同尺度和景观中的变化。这些数据捕捉了绿洲-沙漠系统内的动态，包括水汽通量、能量交换和植被响应。这种理解得益于一个层次化的仪器网络，从多个尺度捕获数据，帮助识别影响这些地区水资源管理和生态系统服务的模式和过程。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in collecting comprehensive multiscale observation data in alpine regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在高山地区收集全面的多尺度观测数据面临的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. Additionally, the scarcity of observation data due to difficulties of access and technological barriers has motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 几个严峻的挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。此外，由于获取困难和技术障碍，观测数据的稀缺促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a need for an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network for studying hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么需要一个集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络来研究高山地区的水文过程？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: In alpine hydrology, consistent hydrometeorological data, snow cover, and frozen ground are crucial indexes and driving forces for hydrological processes. An integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network is essential to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models, and ultimately improve the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯水文学中，一致的水文气象数据、雪盖和冻土是水文过程的重要指标和驱动因素。建立一个综合、分布式和多尺度的观测网络对于提供准确的水文模型强迫数据、验证遥感数据、评估分布式模型，以及最终提高对阿尔卑斯水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of utilizing remote sensing data combined with data assimilation techniques in alpine hydrology research?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 利用遥感数据结合数据同化技术在高山水文学研究中的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing remote sensing data combined with data assimilation techniques can enhance the accuracy and predictive capability of hydrological models by providing comprehensive and spatially distributed information. However, it also necessitates careful validation and calibration to manage uncertainties inherent in remote sensing data, especially in complex alpine terrains.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用遥感数据结合数据同化技术可以提高水文模型的准确性和预测能力，因为它提供了全面和空间分布的信息。然而，这也需要仔细的验证和校准，以管理遥感数据中固有的不确定性，特别是在复杂的高山地形中。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the procedural steps involved in establishing an integrated observation network for capturing snow accumulation and ablation processes in alpine regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山地区建立一个综合观测网络以捕捉积雪积累和消融过程所涉及的程序步骤是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: An integrated observation network for capturing snow accumulation and ablation involves setting up automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and snow observation superstations. The AMSs collect data on meteorological variables such as wind speed, air temperature, humidity, and radiation. At the snow superstation, snow depth and snow water equivalent (SWE) are measured using devices such as the SR50A and GMON. Blowing snow flux is measured with FlowCapt sensors. Data is collected at various temporal resolutions to capture the dynamic processes of snow accumulation and ablation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 一个集成的观测网络用于捕捉雪的积累和融化，涉及设置自动气象站（AMSs）和雪观测超级站。AMSs 收集气象变量的数据，如风速、气温、湿度和辐射。在雪超级站，使用 SR50A 和 GMON 等设备测量雪深和雪水当量（SWE）。吹雪通量通过 FlowCapt 传感器进行测量。数据以不同的时间分辨率收集，以捕捉雪的积累和融化的动态过程。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are soil and canopy component temperatures estimated and validated in the context of TSEB modeling to improve the accuracy of evapotranspiration measurements?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在TSEB建模的背景下，土壤和冠层组分温度是如何估算和验证的，以提高蒸散发测量的准确性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Soil and canopy component temperatures are estimated using thermal infrared images obtained from a high-resolution thermal camera. The images are classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method, and the brightness temperatures are extracted. The thermal infrared temperatures are then converted to radiation temperatures using incoming long-wave radiation data. These simulated radiometric temperatures are validated against surface radiometric temperatures calculated from a four-component radiometer, ensuring accuracy in TSEB modeling for evapotranspiration measurements.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 土壤和冠层组件的温度是通过高分辨率热像仪获得的热红外图像进行估算的。图像使用最大似然法分类为土壤和冠层像素，并提取亮度温度。然后，利用入射长波辐射数据将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。这些模拟的辐射温度通过与四组件辐射计计算的表面辐射温度进行验证，以确保在蒸散发测量中TSEB建模的准确性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements enable the accurate monitoring of snow accumulation and ablation processes in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在高山地区准确监测雪积累和融化过程成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Technological advancements such as the use of ultrasonic sensors for snow depth measurement, GammaMONitor (GMON) for snow water equivalent measurement, and FlowCapt for measuring blowing snow flux are employed to accurately monitor snow accumulation and ablation processes in alpine regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 技术进步如超声波传感器用于雪深测量、GammaMONitor (GMON)用于雪水当量测量，以及FlowCapt用于测量吹雪通量，正在被用于准确监测高山地区的雪积累和融化过程。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What are the challenges that need to be addressed to improve data collection in high-altitude alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在高海拔阿尔卑斯地区改善数据收集需要解决哪些挑战？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Challenges that need to be addressed include the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, complex topography, and technological barriers, which hinder consistent data collection and necessitate the development of advanced ecosystem observation networks and experiments in high-altitude alpine regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 需要解决的挑战包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔、复杂的地形以及技术障碍，这些因素阻碍了一致的数据收集，并且需要在高海拔高山地区开发先进的生态系统观察网络和实验。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the integration of ground-based measurements with remote sensing data be crucial for improving the accuracy of hydrological models in alpine regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么将地面测量与遥感数据相结合对于提高高山地区水文模型的准确性至关重要？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Integrating ground-based measurements with remote sensing data is crucial because ground measurements can provide validation and calibration for remote sensing data, which often contain various uncertainties, especially in complex terrains like alpine regions. This integration helps improve the prediction of hydrological processes by providing accurate forcing data and evaluating distributed models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 将地面测量与遥感数据相结合至关重要，因为地面测量可以为遥感数据提供验证和校准，而遥感数据通常包含各种不确定性，尤其是在像高山地区这样的复杂地形中。这种整合有助于通过提供准确的强迫数据和评估分布式模型来改善水文过程的预测。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in collecting consistent and complete hydrometeorological data in high-altitude alpine regions, and how could these impact data quality?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在高海拔阿尔卑斯地区收集一致和完整的水文气象数据可能会面临哪些挑战，这些挑战如何影响数据质量？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting consistent and complete hydrometeorological data in high-altitude alpine regions include the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which can lead to incomplete data collection and hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and hydrological models. These challenges may result in data gaps and inconsistencies, affecting the overall quality and reliability of the datasets.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在高海拔阿尔卑斯地区收集一致和完整的水文气象数据面临的挑战包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔以及复杂的地形，这可能导致数据收集不完整，并阻碍遥感技术和水文模型的发展。这些挑战可能导致数据缺口和不一致，影响数据集的整体质量和可靠性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective are the current data collection methods in capturing the complex eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes, such as those in the Heihe River Basin?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 当前的数据收集方法在捕捉异质景观中复杂的生态水文过程（例如黑河流域）方面的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The current data collection methods, including automatic meteorological stations, eddy covariance towers, and remote sensing techniques, are designed to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes. However, challenges remain, such as the scarcity of multiscale observations, which hinder progress in understanding these processes. The integration of different data sources and validation with ground-based measurements are essential for improving the accuracy and effectiveness of these methods.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的数据收集方法，包括自动气象站、涡度协方差塔和遥感技术，旨在捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。然而，仍然存在一些挑战，例如多尺度观测的稀缺，这阻碍了对这些过程的理解。整合不同的数据源并与地面测量进行验证，对于提高这些方法的准确性和有效性至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the primary challenges faced in ensuring the reliability and completeness of datasets used for studying alpine hydrological processes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 确保用于研究阿尔卑斯水文过程的数据集的可靠性和完整性所面临的主要挑战是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Primary challenges include the harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography of alpine regions, which inhibit consistent data collection. Technological barriers and the scarcity of observation data further complicate the development of reliable datasets. Efforts to establish comprehensive observation networks and integrate remote sensing with ground-based data aim to address these challenges.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 主要挑战包括严酷的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了一致的数据收集。技术障碍和观测数据的稀缺进一步复杂化了可靠数据集的开发。建立综合观测网络并将遥感与地面数据相结合的努力旨在解决这些挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways can the development of next-generation observation networks improve the predictive understanding of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 下一代观测网络的发展可以通过哪些方式改善对高山地区水文过程的预测理解？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Next-generation observation networks, which integrate distributed and multiscale observation techniques, can improve the predictive understanding of hydrological processes by providing comprehensive datasets that capture key variables such as snow cover, soil moisture, and freeze-thaw cycles. These networks enable better validation of remote sensing data and hydrological models, facilitating more accurate predictions of hydrological processes and their responses to climate change and human activities.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 下一代观测网络整合了分布式和多尺度观测技术，可以通过提供全面的数据集来改善对水文过程的预测理解，这些数据集捕捉了关键变量，如雪盖、土壤湿度和冻融循环。这些网络能够更好地验证遥感数据和水文模型，从而促进对水文过程及其对气候变化和人类活动响应的更准确预测。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how data collection methods in high-altitude regions are adapted to handle harsh climate conditions and complex topography.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解高海拔地区的数据收集方法是如何适应恶劣气候条件和复杂地形的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: To handle harsh climate conditions and complex topography in high-altitude regions, integrated, distributed, and multiscale hydrometeorological networks are established. These include automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations. Special instruments like SR50A for snow depth, GMON for snow water equivalent, and FlowCapt for blowing snow grains are used to capture data. Challenges like power loss and sensor malfunctions due to high altitudes are noted in the datasets, which are used to support alpine hydrology research.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 为了应对高海拔地区恶劣的气候条件和复杂的地形，建立了综合的、分布式的和多尺度的水文气象网络。这些网络包括自动气象站和用于雪和冻土观测的超级站。使用特殊仪器，如SR50A用于雪深测量，GMON用于雪水当量测量，以及FlowCapt用于捕捉吹雪颗粒的数据。这些数据集记录了由于高海拔导致的电力损失和传感器故障等挑战，这些数据被用于支持高山水文学研究。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how multiscale and multidisciplinary data are effectively integrated to study eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白如何有效整合多尺度和多学科数据来研究绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态水文过程。
Assertion.AnswerEn: To study eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems, multiscale and multidisciplinary data are collected through a hierarchically nested instrumentation setup. This includes eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and eco-hydrological sensor networks. Data collection during intensive observation periods and continuous monitoring allows for the integration of multiscale observations, facilitating the understanding of interactions between oasis and desert landscapes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 为了研究绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态水文过程，采用分层嵌套的仪器设置收集多尺度和多学科的数据。这包括涡度协方差塔、自动气象站和生态水文传感器网络。在强化观测期和持续监测期间的数据收集，允许整合多尺度观测，促进对绿洲和沙漠景观之间相互作用的理解。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explain the methods used to ensure quality control and validation of datasets obtained from eco-hydrological sensor networks and remote sensing technologies.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请解释确保从生态水文传感器网络和遥感技术获得的数据集的质量控制和验证的方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: To ensure quality control and validation of datasets from eco-hydrological sensor networks and remote sensing technologies, observational data undergo careful processing, including sensor calibration, data collection, and dataset generation. Techniques such as image classification, calibration of remote sensing products, and the use of high-resolution soil physics datasets are employed. Ground-based measurements are also used to validate remote sensing data, ensuring that datasets are accurate and reliable for scientific analysis.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 为了确保生态水文传感器网络和遥感技术数据集的质量控制和验证，观测数据经过仔细处理，包括传感器校准、数据收集和数据集生成。采用图像分类、遥感产品的校准以及高分辨率土壤物理数据集等技术。还使用地面测量来验证遥感数据，确保数据集准确可靠，适合科学分析。
